Description: Accountants and auditors analyze and interpret accounting records to give advice, prepare financial statements or audit and evaluate statements prepared by others. They are expected to advise on systems of recording costs or other financial and budgetary data.

Actuaries analyze the statistical data and financial cost of risk and uncertainty. They construct probability tables that help businesses assess forecast risk and liability for payment of future benefits. They also ascertain insurance and cash reserves for businesses.

OccupationTitle: Administrative Law Judges, Adjudicators, and Hearing Officers
Description: Workers in this profession conduct hearings and trials, make decisions on government-related claims, determine liability, and recommend settlement outcomes. They also issue subpoenas, prepare written decisions for the court, and keep up-to-date with new laws.

Managers in this field plan, direct, or coordinate various administrative services in an organization. They may oversee budgets, manage office supplies, set department goals or deadlines, analyze internal processes, and supervise other office support services.

OccupationTitle: Adult Education and Literacy Teachers/ Instructors
Description: Instructors in this field teach various out-of-school courses to youth and adults. They may teach remedial education classes or preparatory courses for the General Educational Development test, literacy, or English as a Second Language.

Advertising and promotions managers produce and develop ideas for promotions, contests, and giveaways to create buzz around a particular product, organization, or client account. They organize the campaign, prepare and negotiate contracts, and determine budget.

Advertising sales agents work with markets in TV, radio, outdoor advertising, and the Internet to sell and advertise in their space. They contact clients to offer advertising services, and inform customers of their advertisement options with samples for approval.

Through physics, aerospace engineers design aircraft, spacecraft, satellites, and missiles. They evaluate prototypes to determine functionality and develop criteria for quality standards. Typically, they are specialized in aeronautical or astronautical engineering.

OccupationTitle: Agents/Business Managers for Artists, Performers & Athletes
Description: Agents and managers develop contracts with individuals and work to ensure their clients' success. They manage business and financial affairs for clients and help develop strategies for their careers, while collecting fees or commissions according to contract terms.

These inspectors examine food products, processing procedures, and cleanliness to determine food safety in accordance to government laws and regulations. They create reports on their findings and issue recommendations on any corrective actions that may need to occur.

Teachers in this field educate students about agricultural science through lectures, assignments, and discussions. Courses may include agronomy, dairy sciences, fisheries management, horticultural sciences, poultry sciences, and agricultural soil conservation.

Air traffic controllers direct aircraft in flight patterns to minimize delays and prevent accidents. They direct pilots during arrival and departure, and stay aware of dangerous conditions such as weather or other safety issues and inform pilots accordingly.
Aircraft mechanics and service technicians typically diagnose, adjust, and repair hydraulic and pneumatic systems. This work can also be completed by helicopter and aircraft engine specialists.

OccupationTitle: Aircraft Structure, Surfaces, and Systems Assemblers
Description: Workers in this field assemble, install, and connect parts, fittings, and assemblies on aircraft using a variety of tools and procedures. They adjust, repair, or replace parts to eliminate malfunctions and ensure proper operation.

OccupationTitle: Airline Pilots, Copilots, and Flight Engineers
Description: Workers in this field pilot and navigate flights for fixed wing and multi-engine aircrafts for air carrier routes and transporting cargo and passengers. Additionally, a Federal Air Transport Pilot certificate and rating is needed for each aircraft flown.

Anesthesiologists record the type and amount of anesthetics they administer to patients prior to, during, or after surgery or other medical procedures. They monitor patients before, during, and after anesthesia and counteract adverse reactions or complications.

OccupationTitle: Appraisers and Assessors of Real Estate
Description: Appraisers and assessors of real estate assess property to estimate its fair and true value. They also may assess taxes and determine taxability and value of properties. Both appraisers and assessors must maintain accurate records of their inspections.

OccupationTitle: Architects, Except Landscape and Naval Architects
Description: Architects plan and design structures as small as tool sheds or private residences, to structures as large as a factories or skyscraping office buildings. They consult with clients to determine functional and spatial requirements of structures and then draw blueprints.

Architectural drafters create computer system or hand-drawn plans for buildings and structures based on the architect's specifications. A civil drafter provides the same, but for highways, bridges, pipelines, and underground control systems.

Architectural and engineering managers direct, review, and approve project and design work and activities, as well as research and develop new ideas and proposals for clients. They also prepare budgets, bids, and contracts.

Art directors create and develop design concepts and ideas for visual media including print, broadcasting, and advertising. Other duties include presentation of final layouts to clients, coordination of creative projects, and confirmation and review of budgets.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

OccupationTitle: Art, Drama, and Music Teachers, Postsecondary
Description: Teachers in this field of study educate students on drama, music, fine art, and applied art. Subjects may include acting techniques, fundamentals of music, or art history. They demonstrate artistic techniques, supervise student work, and prepare students for performances.

Rushing onto the field to help injured athletes is only part of the job for athletic trainers. They specialize in preventing, diagnosing, and treating muscle and bone injuries and illnesses. Athletic trainers are there to help children and adults with physical ailments.

OccupationTitle: Atmospheric, Earth, Marine, and Space Sciences Teachers
Description: Teachers in this field administer courses in the physical sciences, except chemistry and physics. Subjects may include geology, atmospheric science, oceanic science, astronomy, and earth science. They must supervise field work, deliver lectures, and conduct research.

These technicians install, adjust, and operate audio and video equipment such as microphones, sound speakers, video screens, projectors, video monitors, recording equipment, and lighting systems. They are also part of the editing and design layout process.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: Audiologists assess, treat, counsel, and otherwise help people with hearing and balance disorders. They use advanced technology to fit hearing aids, provide auditory training, and may perform research related to hearing problems and diseases.

Avionics technicians work with aircraft and space vehicles to install, inspect, test, adjust, and repair avionics equipment such as radar, navigation, radio, and mission control systems. They also interpret flight test data to determine malfunctions.

Biochemists and biophysicists study the chemical and physical principles of living things. In a laboratory, they conduct research to further the understanding of complex chemical combinations and reactions involved in metabolism, reproduction, growth, and heredity.

Biology teachers instruct courses in biological science. They may be expected to develop and deliver lectures or lessons related to molecular biology, marine biology and botany. They supervise classwork, maintain student records and prepare course materials.
Occupations in this field include bioinformatics scientists, molecular and cellular biologists, and geneticists.

Using engineering, biology, and biomechanical principles, biomedical engineers develop, design, and evaluate health systems and products. They work with artificial organs, prostheses, instrumentation, medical information, and care delivery systems.

Boilermakers are trained craftsmen who maintain, assemble, and install large vessels that hold hot liquids and gases. They work on diverse projects ranging from bridges to blast furnaces, to the construction of mining equipment and hot water boilers used for heating.

Brickmasons and blockmasons use bricks, natural stones, structural tile, glass blocks, and concrete blocks to build, repair, and maintain a variety of structures. They work both indoors and outdoors and use a variety of power and hand tools to help complete the job.

Brokerage clerks perform duties related to the purchase, sale, and holding of important documents. Duties include writing orders for stock purchases and sales, receipts, transmittal papers, computing transfer taxes, and verifying stock transactions and holdings.

Budget analysts examine budgets for accuracy and completeness in addition to adhering to procedures and regulations. They gather and analyze accounting records, budgets, and other data to determine operation needs and alternative finance methods.

OccupationTitle: Bus and Truck Mechanics and Diesel Engine Specialists
Description: Workers in this field maintain and repair buses and trucks, as well as different types of diesel engines. They inspect, repair, and maintain all automotive and mechanical parts or equipment.

OccupationTitle: Business Operations Specialists and All Other*
Description: Occupations in this field include energy auditors, security management specialists, customs brokers, business continuity planners, sustainability specialists, and online merchants.

Postsecondary business teachers instruct courses in business administration and management such as accounting, marketing, finance, and human resources. They must evaluate and grade students' work, facilitate classroom discussions, and prepare course materials.

OccupationTitle: Buyers and Purchasing Agents, Farm Products
Description: Workers in this field purchase farm products for processing or resale. Typically, they purchase for tree farm contractors, grain brokers, market operators, and grain and tobacco buyers. They review orders and arrange processing and transportation for purchased products.

OccupationTitle: Camera Operators, Television, Video, and Motion Picture
Description: Camera operators capture images and record scenes for TV, advertising, video production, motion pictures, and various other purposes. They apply technical aspects, make edits for production, and often handle sound and lighting equipment.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

OccupationTitle: Captains, Mates, and Pilots of Water Vessels
Description: Workers in this field command or supervise operations of ships and water vessels such as tugboats or ferryboats. They must acquire a license issued by the U.S. Coast Guard.

Using imaging technology, cardiovascular technologists and technicians help physicians diagnose cardiac and peripheral ailments in patients. They also use electrocardiogram equipment and explain the testing procedures to patients to reduce anxiety.

Teachers in this field work with students in public and private schools for middle, intermediate and junior high schools. They create and implement lesson plans for career and technical or vocational subjects, and adapt materials according to students' needs.

These teachers work at the secondary school level (public or private) and instruct occupational, career and technical, or other vocational subjects. Teachers administer and grade tests, maintain accurate student records, and establish lesson plans.

Carpenters construct, install, or repair structures and fixtures made of wood. This includes concrete forms, building frameworks, wood stairways, hardwood floors, or window and door frames. They may also install cabinets, siding, or drywall.

Cartographers and photogrammetrists collect, analyze, and interpret geographic information provided by geodetic surveys, aerial photographs, and satellite data. They make, research, and study maps and charts for political, cultural, educational, and other purposes.

Chefs and head cooks often do more directing and supervising than cooking; they plan and price menu items, check food quality and food safety regulations, inspect and order kitchen supplies, and instruct other cooks on the preparation and complete presentation of food.
Category: Food Preparation and Serving Related Occupations

Description: Chemical engineers design chemical plant equipment and plan processes for manufacturing chemicals and products including cement, detergents, gasoline, paper, and plastic. They also determine effective arrangements for operations, perform tests, and monitor performance.

In order to prevent fires or explosions, chemical equipment operators regulate machines, inspect equipment, test product samples, record data, monitor gauges and meters, and follow extensive safety protocols to maintain the facility.

These operators control various chemical process machines, examine samples of product for quality tests, strictly follow safety regulations, and follow equipment protocol during emergency situations. They are in charge of many vital roles within a chemical plant.

Chemical technicians conduct laboratory tests to assist scientists in qualitative and quantitative analysis of gas, liquid, and solid material for development and research. This development or research may include work in experimental, theoretical, or practical chemistry.

Postsecondary chemistry teachers instruct classes pertaining to the chemical and physical properties and compositional changes of substances. They teach methods of qualitative and quantitative chemical analysis. Instructors may also take part in research and field work.

In laboratories, chemists create analyses and conduct experiments by various analytical methods. They prepare test solutions, compile and analyze test information, and determine equipment or process efficiency. They handle lab malfunctions and errors as necessary.

As the highest level of management, chief executives appoint department managers, direct human resources activities, approve contracts with suppliers and distributors, implement policies, and determine where improvements and changes can be made within the company.

Workers in this field help improve the social and psychological functioning of children and their families. They may assist parents, arrange adoptions, or find foster homes for endangered children. They may help with teenage pregnancy and misbehavior or truancy in schools.

Workers in this field assess, treat, and care for patients by making alignments to their spine, pelvic, and musculoskeletal system. They analyze x-rays, locate the source of the problem and use their hands to make manual adjustments to the patient's body.

Civil engineering technicians plan, design, and construct maintenance of structures and facilities under direction from engineering staff and physical scientists. Other duties include drafting of drawings for layouts of future projects for specific specifications.

Civil engineers plan, design, and oversee construction and maintenance of building structures and facilities. This may include roads, railroads, irrigation projects, airports, bridges, harbors, channels, dams, power plants, or water and sewage systems.

Within an insurance agency, these workers evaluate property damage, conduct interviews to compile information for review, calculate benefit payments, and examine forms to determine extent of liability. They require strong analytical, negotiation, and interview skills.

Clergy members conduct religious worship and carry out other spiritual functions regarding beliefs and practices of religious faith or denomination. They prepare and deliver sermons, train leaders of the church, and provide comfort to those in need.

Clinical, counseling, and school psychologists diagnose and treat mental disorders, learning disabilities, and cognitive, behavioral, and emotional problems. They observe, interpret, and record how people relate to one another and their surrounding environment.

Designers in this field work with products such as cars, home appliances, and children's toys. Tasks include development and design for products and research of product use, along with marketing and materials for appealing placement and product design for the public.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: Commercial pilots fly airplanes or helicopters on nonscheduled air carrier routes. They may test aircraft, direct firefighting efforts, give air tours, monitor traffic, dust crops, spread seed for restoration, track criminals, or fly an air ambulance.

Instructors in this field teach courses related to communications. Subjects may include organizational communication, public relations, broadcasting, or journalism. They prepare lesson plans and assignments, develop and grade examinations, and plan course curriculum.

Managers in this field determine the compensation and benefits for employees within an organization. They are aware of legal requirements, continually keep company budget in mind while making decisions, and notify employees of changes in benefits or compensation.

OccupationTitle: Compensation, Benefits, and Job Analysis Specialists
Description: Compensation, benefits, and job analysis specialists evaluate job positions, determine exempt or non-exempt status, and salary. They also plan, develop, and communicate methods for compensating, evaluating, promoting, and training workers.

Compliance officers examine, evaluate, and investigate the actions of an organization or individual to ensure they are in agreement with the laws and regulations in place. They perform inspections and analyze behaviors to enforce regulation.

Workers in this field conduct research on fundamental computer and information science as theorists, designers, or inventors. They find solutions to computer hardware and software issues, and work with management, vendors, and technicians to determine computing needs.

Workers in this field plan or coordinate activities in areas such as electronic data processing, information systems, systems analysis, and computer programming. They develop resources to provide data security, strategic computing, and disaster recovery.

OccupationTitle: Computer Controlled Machine  Programmers, Metal and Plastic
Description: Workers in this field develop programs for machining and processing of metal and plastic parts for automatic machine tools, equipment, and systems. Programmers also write, modify, and enter computer commands into machine controllers.

Computer hardware engineers test computers and related products for commercial, industrial, military, and scientific purposes. They also analyze and identify user needs for hardware and direct technicians or engineering designers for technical support.

Occupations in this field include software quality assurance engineers and testers, computer systems engineers/architects, web administrators, geospatial information scientists and technologists, geographic information systems technicians, and database architects.

Computer programmers create, modify, and test codes for forms and scripts for computer applications to run properly. They may also work with software developers to help design or analyze software solutions, in addition to writing and developing computer programs.

Postsecondary computer science teachers instruct computer science courses, which may involve the design and function of computers or operations and research analysis. They prepare lessons, evaluate tests and assignments, and moderate classroom discussions.

Computer support specialists provide technical assistance to computer users, resolving issues for clients in person, or via telephone or electronically. This includes computer technicians, information technology specialists, network support specialists, and others.

Computer systems analysts work to implement and improve computer systems by studying an organization's current systems and procedures. They make recommendations to management in order to help the bring business and IT together and operate more efficiently.

Conservation scientists improve, manage, and protect our natural resources; they conduct soil surveys and develop plans to eliminate soil erosion. They also instruct farmers on best practices for crop rotation, plowing, and terracing to conserve water and soil.

Construction managers oversee activities concerned with the construction and maintenance of structures, facilities, and systems. They are involved in the conceptual development of a construction project and manage its organization, budget, schedule, and implementation.

OccupationTitle: Construction Trades Supervisors and Extraction Workers
Description: First-Line supervisors of construction trades and extraction workers supervise, schedule, and coordinate the activities of construction or extraction workers. They read specifications, such as blueprints to determine construction requirements and plan procedures.

Inspectors in this field assess structures using engineering skills to check for structural soundness. They confirm structures are compliant with specifications, building codes, and other criteria. They may be general or work in one area such as electrical or plumbing.

Mining machine operators lead crews in determining locations for holes and channels to be cut and supervising those who lay tracks to those areas. They operate and repair mining machinery, including those that rip coal, metal and non-metal ores from the mine.

OccupationTitle: Control and Valve Repairers, Except Mechanical Door
Description: Mechanical regulating and controlling devices are installed, maintained, and repaired by these technicians. Those in this field also deal with hazardous field situations, test valves and regulators for leaks, and disassemble and repair parts as needed.

Cost estimators collect and analyze data in order to estimate the costs of various projects for organizations. They give an estimate for time, money, resources, and labor required for manufacturing, construction projects, or services to aid management's decisions.

Counselors are trained to give advice on personal, social, or psychological problems to people on many different levels. They are often specialized in different areas such as: school counselor, relationship counselor, Christian counselor, professional counselor, etc.

Court reporters are responsible for using equipment to accurately record all court proceedings, legislative assemblies, or committee meetings verbatim. Upon request, they provide judges or lawyers with transcripts and must file a copy with the court clerk's office.

Operators in this field operate mechanical and cable equipment to lift and transport heavy materials or machines. They inspect and clean equipment to ensure safe operation. They must also review daily work and deliveries in order to remain on schedule.

Credit analysts examine credit data and financial statements of individuals or firms to measure the degree of risk involved in extending credit or lending money. They develop reports with credit information for use in decision making.

OccupationTitle: Criminal Justice and Law Enforcement Teachers, Postsecondary
Description: Instructors in this field teach courses in criminal justice, corrections and law enforcement administration. They develop and deliver lectures on topics such as criminal law, defensive policing or investigative techniques. They also plan and evaluate curriculum.

Curators administer, plan, and organize the acquisition of storage and exhibition of collections of artwork, historic items, scientific specimens of museums or other institutions, and other collectables. They also write and review grant proposals and journal articles.

Database administrators are extremely tech-savvy and use their computer knowledge of database management systems in order to help organizations run smoothly. They also plan, coordinate, and implement security measures to safeguard the computer database.

Dental hygienists clean teeth and examine areas such as the head, neck, and jaw for signs of possible oral disease. They maintain dental equipment, provide preventative dental care, and also educate patients on ways to improve and maintain good oral health.

Dentists examine, diagnose, and apply treatment to diseases, injuries, and malformations of teeth and gums. They treat diseases of nerve, pulp, and other dental tissues affecting oral hygiene and retention of teeth, as well as providing preventative care to patients.

Derrick operators of oil and gas rig derrick equipment to operate pumps and to assist in circulating of mud through a drill hole. Some tasks include inspection of derricks for flaws and for cleanliness for proper working conditions. They also repair pumps or mud tanks.

Detectives and criminal investigators work to uphold Federal, State, or local laws. This includes police detectives, police identification and records officers, criminal investigators and special agents, immigration and customs inspectors, and intelligence analysts.

Diagnostic medical sonographers use medical equipment that directs sound waves into a patient's body in order to produce images that help to assess and diagnose medical conditions. They decide which images to include by looking for healthy and pathological areas.

Workers in this field plan and coordinate food service or nutritional programs to help promote good health and disease control. They may counsel individuals, conduct nutritional research or supervise activities of a department providing quantity food services.
This field refers to the small percentage of drafters whose job duties aren't listed separately.

OccupationTitle: Earth Drillers, Except Oil and Gas
Description: Earth drillers drill holes into rock in order to blast, grout, anchor, or build foundations. They must operate machinery and regulate all aspects of the drilling, including the control speed and placement, as well as selecting the appropriate tools needed for each job.

Teachers in this field prepare and administer courses related to economics. Subjects may include econometrics, price theory, microeconomics, and macroeconomics. They grade assignments, deliver lectures, manage course materials, and moderate classroom discussions.

Economists conduct research, create plans, and prepare reports for problems related the production and distribution of goods and services. They may also collect economic data for sampling techniques and econometric methods.

In-office or remote, editors develop content ideas, rewrite and edit copy to improve readability, and adhere to publication styles and brand standards. They may also be in charge of artwork, layout, printing, and restrictions such as deadlines and budget requirements.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: Education administrators for preschool and childcare programs plan, direct, and coordinate the activities of preschool and childcare centers. They set educational standards and goals, and help establish policies, procedures, and programs to carry them out.
Occupations in this field include distance learning coordinators, and fitness and wellness coordinators.

OccupationTitle: Education Administrators, Elementary and Secondary School
Description: Workers in this area are typically leaders who direct, coordinate, and plan activities for private and public elementary or secondary schools. They also collaborate with teachers to plan curriculum, and they develop and set performance goals and objectives.

Administrators in this field coordinate or provide educational activities or services at postsecondary institutions such as universities and colleges. Positions include academic dean, financial aid director, registrar, college president, provost, or admissions director.

Education teachers instruct students in educating others. Courses may include counseling, curriculum, guidance, or English as a second language. They facilitate classroom discussions or demonstrations, prepare lessons and assignments, and supervise students' fieldwork.

OccupationTitle: Educational, Guidance, School, and Vocational Counselors
Description: Workers in this field counsel individuals and offer group educational and vocational guidance services. They help others to overcome personal, social, or behavioral problems and provide crisis intervention to students when traumatic events occur at schools.

OccupationTitle: Electrical  Repairers, Commercial and Industrial Equipment
Description: Workers in this field repair, test, and install various electronic equipments. They inspect components to prevent or diagnose malfunctions, study blueprints to determine installation procedures, maintain equipment logs, and perform numerous preventative tasks.

These technicians apply electrical and/or electronic theory to design, build, repair, and modify electrical components and machinery for evaluation by the engineering staff. They read blueprints, write reports, and perform preventative maintenance on equipment.

Electrical engineers design, create, and test manufacturing and installation of electrical equipment and their components for commercial, industrial, military, or scientific use. They also lead project production efforts to ensure project efficiency.

OccupationTitle: Electrical Installers and Repairers, Transportation Equipment
Description: These workers install and maintain mobile electronic communications on trains, watercraft, and other mobile equipment. They locate and solve malfunctions such as defective wiring, evaluate electrical systems and equipment, and install new equipment as required.

Electrical power-line installers and repairers install different electrical equipment including cables, wires, electrical outlets, electrical poles, and heavy-duty transmission towers. They also test equipment and follow safety protocol to ensure safe work areas.

OccupationTitle: Electrical Repairers, Powerhouse, Substation, and Relay
Description: Workers in this field are required to analyze data to diagnose and evaluate malfunctions and characteristics of systems. They also construct, test, maintain, and repair substation relay and control systems. In addition, workers maintain records of all repairs and tests.
Electrical and electronics drafters prepare wire diagrams, circuit board assembly diagrams, and layout drawings for manufacturing, installing, and repairing of electrical equipment.

Electricians install, maintain, and repair electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures for electrical systems in homes, businesses, and factories. They work indoors or outdoors and use a variety of tools including power construction equipment and measuring devices.

Workers in this green career handle electromechanical equipment in areas such as unmanned submarines, aircraft, oil rigs, or hazardous waste removal. They test the performance of machinery, analyze the results, and prepare written documentation of their findings.

Electronic engineers design electronic components for commercial, industrial, military, or scientific use.  They design both software and hardware components and make modifications to existing components to improve technical performance.

OccupationTitle: Elementary School Teachers, Except Special Education
Description: Elementary school teachers assist students in learning basic academic, social, and other formative skills. They prepare materials and activities for lessons, establish and enforce classroom rules, and evaluate students' behavior and development.

Elevator installers and repairers repair, install, or assemble electric and hydraulic passenger and freight elevators, escalators, moving sidewalks, and dumbwaiters. They also test newly installed equipment for building codes, standards, and specifications.

Eligibility interviewers evaluate an applicant's need for benefits and assistance (such as welfare, unemployment, social security, and public housing) and through examining documents and interviews, they determine what the applicant qualifies for.

Emergency management directors plan emergency response and crisis management for disasters such as hurricanes, floods, and earthquakes. In addition, they provide training, awareness, and procedure plans for other emergencies including hostage situations.

Engineering teachers design and instruct courses related to the application of physical laws and principles of engineering. They teach classes pertaining to chemical, civil, electrical, industrial, mechanical, mineral, and petroleum engineering.

Occupations in this field include non-destructive testing specialists, electrical engineering technologists, electromechanical engineering technologists, photonics technicians, fuel cell technicians, and nanotechnology engineering technologists and technicians.

Occupations in this field include biochemical engineers, validation engineers, energy and manufacturing engineers, mechatronics and microsystems engineers, photonics, nanosystems and robotics engineers, wind energy engineers, and solar energy systems engineers.

OccupationTitle: English Language and Literature Teachers, Postsecondary
Description: Workers in this field teach classes in English language and literature. Subjects may include comparative literature, linguistics, poetry, or novel structure. They moderate classroom discussion, develop course curriculum, maintain student records, and evaluate assignments.

Working both out and indoors, environmental engineering technicians carry out the plans that environmental engineers develop. They apply the theory of environmental engineering to test and operate equipment for preventing or cleaning up environmental pollution.

Through the integration of soil science, biology, chemistry, and engineering principles, environmental engineers develop solutions for environmental problems. They work towards improving recycling, waste disposal, public health, and control of water and air pollution.

Workers perform laboratory and field tests to monitor the environment. Under the direction of environmental scientists, they record test data and prepare reports, summaries, or charts that investigate sources of pollution, including those that affect health.

OccupationTitle: Environmental Scientists and Specialists, Including Health
Description: Environmental scientists and specialists research and investigate pollutants or hazards that affect the environment or health of the population. They collect samples to determine what actions can be made to prevent or resolve pollution issues.

OccupationTitle: Executive Secretaries and Executive Admin. Assistants
Description: These workers provide high-level and quality assistance and support to executives along with training and supervising lower-level administrative staff. They also do research, write reports and letters, arrange conference calls, and schedule meetings.

Family and general practitioners diagnose, treat, and help prevent common illnesses, diseases, and injuries that effect the general population. In a normal day they prescribe, administer treatment, therapy, medication, vaccination, and give medical care to patients.

Advisors in this field assist individuals and families involved in agriculture or home economics activities. They train others in product development, sales, use of equipment to demonstrate procedures, and apply research findings to solve related problems.

Fashion designers create original designs through sketches and write construction specifications for workers who sew garments. The designer chooses fabrics, studies design trends, attends fashion shows, and supplies sample garments to agents for fashion shows.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: Film and video editors conduct the editing process for directors and producers; they assemble and organize raw footage. They also determine specific audio and visual effects, and set up and operate computer editing systems and video equipment to complete a film.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: Financial analysts provide guidance for the investment programs of public or private institutions. They draw charts and graphs, using computer spreadsheets, to illustrate technical reports and assess the performance of stocks, bonds, and other types of investments.

Working in an office setting, financial examiners enforce and ensure compliance with laws and regulations governing financial and securities institutions and transactions. They often review balance sheets, operate income and expense accounts, and loan documentation.

Financial managers work to provide information, solutions, assistance, and direction toward investments, banking, insurance, and security either at a branch or office. Other occupations include treasurers and controllers.
Occupations in this field include financial specialists, financial quantitative analysts, risk management specialists, investment underwriters, and fraud examiners, investigators, and analysts.

OccupationTitle: Fine Artists, Including Painters, Sculptors & Illustrators
Description: Fine artists, including painters, sculptors, and illustrators develop and bring to existence original artwork using computer software, pens, watercolors, oil, or raw materials. Most work with various mediums and techniques at once.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: Fire inspectors and investigators work to determine the cause of fires and explosions. They also inspect buildings to detect and prevent fire hazards, conduct investigations, enforce local and state laws and ordinances, and maintain accurate and detailed reports.

Firefighters contain and work to extinguish fires, respond to emergency situations, such as safety of other lives, property, and the environment. Other duties may include emergency medical service, hazardous material response, search and rescue, and disaster assistance.

Working in a jail or correctional facility, officers are expected to discipline and maintain order and security in accordance with policies and laws. They also complete administrative tasks, respond to emergencies, and supervise and coordinate activities for jailers.

OccupationTitle: First-Line Supervisors of Non-Retail Sales Workers
Description: First-line supervisors plan budgets and work schedules, track accounts, and work with company officials to develop procedures to increase sales. They often lead in the hiring process and coordinate company meetings and activities between departments.

OccupationTitle: First-Line Supervisors of Production and Operating Workers
Description: These supervisors directly oversee production activities and workers such as inspectors, fabricators and various operators. They follow safety and sanitation procedures, develop work schedules, and inspect materials, products, gauges, and equipment to prevent errors.

Food scientists and technologists develop and research ways to make processed foods safe and healthy, and apply from research to the packaging and preserving of the food. They use chemistry, microbiology, engineering, and other sciences to analyze food content.

Food service managers supervise operations in an organization or department that serves food. They abide by health guidelines, verify delivery contents from vendors, and work with head chefs to determine preparation methods, portion sizes, and overall presentation.

OccupationTitle: Foreign Language and Literature Teachers, Postsecondary
Description: Instructors in this field teach courses in languages other than English. This includes foreign languages as well as American Sign Language. Teachers develop lesson plans, facilitate classroom discussions, evaluate papers or assignments and maintain course materials.

These technicians gather, identify, and analyze physical evidence related to criminal investigations. They perform tests on weapons or substances to determine significance to the investigation. Specializations include ballistics, fingerprinting, or handwriting.

OccupationTitle: Funeral Service Managers, Directors and Morticians
Description: Workers in this field coordinate or direct the services or resources of funeral homes. They may coordinate transportation of the body to the mortuary, work with families to arrange details, or assist in the selection of pallbearers and religious officiates.

Gaming supervisors observe operations and coordinate activities for workers. They also ensure games are covered for each shift, explain operating rules, and may organize and plan gaming activities for guests in hotels and casinos.

Using extensive mechanical knowledge, operators control and monitor compressors, refrigeration, flow gauges, and must determine causes of abnormalities to make recommendations. They also ensure that hazardous materials and products are safely stored.

Found in a wide range of industries, general and operations managers coordinate the operations of an organization. They direct activities within different departments, prepare work schedules, oversee financial and budget activities, and determine staffing requirements.

Technicians in this field assist scientists or engineers in the use of electronic, sonic, or nuclear measuring instruments to acquire data indicating potential resources such as gas, petroleum, coal, minerals, or metallic ore.

Geoscientists use geological, physics and mathematics knowledge to study the physical aspects of Earth. They may be involved in the exploration for oil, minerals, gas, or underground water. Geoscientists often work at remote, far away field sites.

Graphic designers create and design artwork for specific products or materials. This can include packaging, displays, logos, or websites. Their work may be showcased online or in print, and is often created by using various software programs.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

OccupationTitle: Health & Safety Engineers, Except Mining Engineer/Inspector
Description: Workers in this field promote safety and knowledge for the industrial processes, mechanics, chemistry, psychology and industrial health safety laws. This also includes engineers who work in industrial product safety, fire-prevention and protection, and product safety.

OccupationTitle: Health Diagnosing and Treating Practitioners, All Other
Description: This field refers to the small percentage of occupations that do not fall into the other health diagnosing and treating practitioner categories.

Health educators promote general wellness, healthy behaviors, and lifestyles. They develop and present educational programs and materials to help people make healthy choices. They also serve as a resource to assist individuals and the community with health education.

Teachers in this field administer courses in health specialties such as dentistry, laboratory technology, medicine, pharmacy, public health, therapy, and veterinary medicine. They prepare lesson plans, facilitate classroom discussions, and maintain student records.

OccupationTitle: Healthcare Practitioners and Technical Occupations Workers, All Other*
Description: This field refers to the small percentage of occupations that do not fall into the other healthcare practitioner and technical worker categories.

Healthcare social workers provide individuals and families with the support needed to cope with chronic, acute, or terminal illnesses. They advise family caregivers, provide patient education and counseling, and make referrals for other helpful services.

OccupationTitle: Heating, Air Conditioning, and Refrigeration Mechanics
Description: Heating, air conditioning, and refrigeration mechanics work to install, repair, and maintain heating, central air conditioning, and refrigeration systems. They often travel from site-to-site to repair or replace defective equipment, components, or wiring.

History teachers instruct courses in human history and historiography. Topics may include ancient history, postwar civilizations, American history, or world history. They prepare lesson plans, deliver lectures, moderate classroom discussions, and maintain student records.

OccupationTitle: Human Resources & Labor Relations Specialists, All Other*
Description: This field refers to the small percentage of occupations that do not fall into the other human resources, training, and labor relations specialist categories.

Human resources managers supervise and collaborate with staff and colleagues, along with planning and coordinating activities. They also modify and create compensation and benefits plans for employees and equal employment opportunity policies.

These engineers may work with electronics in telecommunications, aerospace guidance, acoustics, or instruments and controls. They prepare sketches for construction, design software and product components, and inspect finished products to ensure quality standards.

Industrial engineers work to design, develop, test, and evaluate integrated systems for industrial production processes such as cost analysis, inventory and quality control, logistics and material flow, and production coordination.

Industrial machinery mechanics are highly skilled workers who keep machinery and industrial equipment in good working order. They repair, install, adjust, and maintain production and processing machinery and pipeline distribution systems.

Industrial production managers plan and coordinate work and resources necessary for production, processing, and distribution for industry organizations. Additionally, they review operations and communicate with staff to resolve production or processing issues.

OccupationTitle: Information Analysts, Web Dev., & Computer Network Architects
Description: Information technology (IT) is heavily used to advance organizational goals. Security Analysts help secure companies against cyber attacks, web developers create websites, and computer network architects create and maintain internal networks within an organization.

Instructional coordinators manage educational content, develop instructional material, and incorporate current technology in specialized fields. They provide guidelines to educators for developing curriculum and conducting courses.

Auto insurance appraisers estimate repair costs for insurance claim settlements and prepare insurance forms of estimates and recommendations. They work with clients and repair shops to determine the total-loss value of the vehicle.

Insurance sales agents contact potential customers and sell them various types of insurance. They can work for brokerage companies or single insurance companies. Agents discuss the various types of policies and help customers find the best plan for them.

Insurance underwriters review individual applications for insurance to determine risk factors, losses, catastrophe, and evaluate policies. In addition, they also review company records to determine the amount of insurance for a single risk or group.

Interior designers plan, arrange, and furnish interiors of residential, commercial, or industrial buildings. They formulate a practical and aesthetic design that is conducive to intended purposes. Some specialize in a specific field, style, or phase of interior design.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: General internists diagnose and provide non-surgical treatment of diseases and internal organ problems. Providing care primarily for adults with problems such as hypertension, heart disease, diabetes, and problems of the lungs, brain, kidney, and gastrointestinal tract.

Interpreters and translators help people interpret oral or sign language, or translate text and information from a foreign language to one that the person is fluent in. They work in schools, hospitals, courtrooms, and conference centers.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: Workers in this career field work on criminal cases, sentence defendants, perform wedding ceremonies or arbitrate, advise, adjudicate, or administer justice in a court of law. They also advise other legal workers regarding conduct, issues, and proceedings.

Judicial law clerks inform and communicate with judges about research done in preparation for legal documents. They review complaints, petitions, motions, pleadings, and dockets of pending litigation. Judicial law clerks must have excellent research skills.

Kindergarten teachers instruct basic natural and social science, music, art, and literature to students. They assist in physical, mental, and social development. They prepare activities to teach simple skills such as colors, shapes, numbers, and letters.

Landscape architects design land areas for parks, airports, highways, schools, and other recreational facilities. They must inspect the land and prepare cost estimates, prepare examples of proposed plans, and identify appropriate materials for use in landscape designs.

Supervisors in this field manage and coordinate the activities of landscapers or groundskeepers. They may establish and enforce operating procedures, schedule work for crews, and inspect completed work to ensure quality standards are met.
Category: Building and Grounds Cleaning and Maintenance

Description: Law teachers educate students on matters pertaining to law such as civil procedures, contracts, and torts. They prepare course materials, develop lesson plans, evaluate assignments, and advise students on academic or career issues.

Lawyers represent clients for civil and criminal cases and legal proceedings, communicate and develop legal documents, and advise clients on legal issues. Additionally, lawyers may specialize in a specific area of law or in many areas they may be interested in.

A legal secretary prepares and delivers legal documents including summonses, complaints, motions, and subpoenas. There are general secretarial duties (scheduling appointments, mailing and faxing, etc.) but strong legal terminology and research skills are  also required.

OccupationTitle: Legal Support Workers and All Other
Description: Occupations in this field include court reporters, law clerks, title examiners, abstractors, and searchers.

Librarians work in areas including public libraries, schools, museums, corporations, government agencies, law firms, non-profit organizations, or healthcare. They also classify, circulate, and maintain library materials, in addition to strategic research.

OccupationTitle: Licensed Practical and Licensed Vocational Nurses
Description: Licensed practical nurses (LPN) and licensed vocational nurses (LVN) provide basic nursing care for disabled, ill, or injured people in hospitals, nursing homes, clinics, private homes, or group homes. They work under the direction of registered nurses and doctors.
This field refers to the small percentage of life scientists whose job duties aren't listed separately.

OccupationTitle: Life, Physical, and Social Science Technicians, All Other
Description: Occupations in this field include quality control analysts, precision agriculture technicians, and remote sensing technicians.

Officers obtain and collect copies of individual's credit histories and other financial information to determine feasibility of granting loans. They explain loan options and ensure applications are complete and accurate before submitting to credit analysts for review.

Train engineers drive electric, steam, and other locomotives to transport passengers or freight. They follow conductor's signals and keep alert for emergency conditions on the tracks, check brakes, brake lines, gauges, and other parts of the train before travel.

Lodging managers provide accommodations for guests, maintain order and coordinate hotel activities. Additionally, they may greet and register guests, inspect rooms and restrooms for cleanliness, and observe and manage staff.

The life cycle of a product including acquisition, distribution, internal allocation, delivery, and final disposal of resources revolves around the logistician. They analyze and coordinate the logistical functions of a firm or organization's supply chain.

Management analysts analyze business operations and propose new ways to increase organizational efficiencies. They give advice to management and make recommendations on how a company can lower costs, increase revenues, and increase overall profitability.

Occupations in this field include managers of regulatory affairs, compliance, investment fund, supply chain, security, loss prevention, wind energy operations managers, wind energy project managers, and brownfield redevelopment specialists and site managers.

OccupationTitle: Market Research Analysts and Marketing Specialists*
Description: Market research analysts and marketing specialists analyze market conditions in local, regional, or national areas, and create marketing campaigns or recommendations. They help companies determine what products people want, who will buy them, and for how much.

Marketing managers lead a company's marketing initiatives; they coordinate market research studies and analyze their findings, evaluate financial aspects of a project, identify market strategy and potential customers, and work to maximize the firm's profits.

Marriage and family therapists treat mental health and emotional disorders within the context of marriage or family settings for a wide variety of people. They listen to clients, ask questions, and develop strategies to help fix problems and improve patients' lives.

Materials engineers plan and implement operations in laboratories to develop procedures for materials that also meet cost, specifications for products, and performance standards. They may also supervise other engineers, scientists, or technologists and technicians.

Teachers in this field instruct courses pertaining to mathematical concepts, statistics and actuarial science. Topics may include linear algebra, differential equations or discrete mathematics. They prepare and maintain student records, course materials and lesson plans.

Mechanical drafters develop and prepare diagrams of machinery and mechanical devices that of which include fastening methods, engineering information and dimensions. They also create illustrations and blueprints for manuals, mechanical equipment, dies, and tools.

Technicians in this field develop and modify machinery and equipment, analyze test results for machinery to meet specifications, and read various controls to determine parts performance. They work under the direction of engineering staff or physical scientists.

Mechanical engineers help plan and design engineering tools, engines, machines, and other mechanical equipment. They also work on maintenance, repair, installation, and operation for centralized heat, gas, water, and steam systems.

OccupationTitle: Media and Communication Equipment Workers, All Other
Description: This field refers to the small percentage of media and communication equipment workers whose job duties aren't listed separately.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

OccupationTitle: Media and Communication Workers, All Other
Description: This field refers to the small percentage of media and communication workers whose job duties aren't listed separately.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: Medical and clinical laboratory technologists perform complex medical lab tests for treatment, prevention, and diagnosis of diseases.  In addition to daily tasks, they may also supervise or train new staff such as lab assistants or technicians.

Medical and health services managers, also called healthcare executives or healthcare administrators, plan, direct, and coordinate medical services in hospitals, clinics, managed care organizations, public health agencies, or similar healthcare organizations.

The medical equipment used in hospital and clinics is maintained and installed by these repairers. Medical equipment repairers test, calibrate, and adjust biomedical and electromedical equipment following the manufacturer's manual and troubleshooting techniques.

Medical scientists, except epidemiologists, conduct research to better understand human diseases and improvement of human health. They plan, direct, and participate in studies involving clinical investigations, and both research and development.

Meeting, convention, and event planners are in charge or running, planning, coordinating, and arranging all of the details of group meetings, gatherings, conventions, or events for organizations. The monitor the event to ensure success throughout all activities.

Microbiologists investigate the growth, development, and structure of different plants and organisms including bacteria, algae, and fungi. They use microscopes to identify and observe microorganisms and study the structure of plant tissues, cells, pathogens, and toxins.

OccupationTitle: Middle School Teachers, Except Special & Technical Ed.
Description: Middle school teachers instruct students in one or more subjects at the middle, intermediate, or junior high level. They prepare and grade tests and assignments, maintain student records, and teach lessons using lectures, discussions, or activities.

Millwrights work with various types of heavy equipment and machinery in a wide range of industries. Their ensure proper functioning of belts and motors, install and dismantle machines with hand tools and power tools, operate forklifts, and read blueprints.

OccupationTitle: Mobile Heavy Equipment Mechanics, Except Engines
Description: Mechanics in this field diagnose and repair mobile equipment used in construction, logging, and surface mining. This requires them to replace damaged parts, diagnose malfunctions, and perform routine maintenance work on cranes, bulldozers, graders, or conveyors.

Multimedia artists and animators create and design works using complex graphics, cinematography, character development, and storyboards. They work using film, video, computers, and other electronic tools for media production and publishing.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: Music directors and composers' direct music groups such as orchestras, bands, choirs, and glee clubs in vocal, conduct, or instrumental performances. They arrange auditions and rehearsals and adapt compositions for a specific group or style.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: Natural sciences managers coordinate, direct and plan events and activities for the fields of life and physical sciences, mathematics and statistics. Similar job titles include water team leader, fisheries director, laboratory manager and natural resources planner.

Working primarily at a desk in an office setting, network and computer systems administrators install, configure, and support an organization's network systems. They are responsible for the day-to-day operation of maintaining an organizations computer networks.

Nuclear engineers direct and conduct research for nuclear engineering projects including problems associated with the release, control and use of nuclear energy and nuclear waste disposal. They also monitor equipment to ensure efficiency and safety within a plant.

Technologists in this field prepare and measure radioactive isotopes in therapeutic, diagnostic, and tracer studies using a variety of equipment. They perform studies on blood volume, red cell survival, and fat absorption according to standard laboratory techniques.

In classroom or clinical settings, nursing instructors demonstrate and teach patient care to students. Topics may include pharmacology, mental health nursing, or community health care practices. They deliver lectures, evaluate class work, and maintain student records.

Obstetricians and gynecologists provide medical care related to pregnancy and child birth and help identify, diagnose, treat, and prevent diseases of women. They also collect and maintain patient information, such as medical histories, reports, and examination results.

Occupational health and safety specialists' work with engineers and physicians to provide safe conditions for patients, inspect and evaluate workplace environment and equipment to ensure safety standards and government regulations are adhered to.

Workers in this field collect and document data of work environments for the health of employees. They test workplaces for environmental hazards and implement programs that reduce the risk of chemical, physical, and biological risks to employees.

Occupational therapists help people with disabilities or developmental delays gain independence. They assess, plan, organize, and participate in rehabilitative programs to help build and restore vocational, homemaking, and daily living skills for people of all ages.

Occupational therapy assistants help and aide occupational therapists in treating patients with injuries, illnesses, or disabilities through therapeutic use of everyday activities. They help patients find therapy activities that fit their needs and capabilities.

OccupationTitle: Operating Engineers/ Other Construction Equipment Operators
Description: Workers in this field will operate one or several types of power construction equipment including: motor graders, bulldozers, scrapers, compressors, pumps, derricks, tractors, or front-end loaders to excavate, move, and grade earth, erect structures, or pour concrete.

Analysts are expected to formulate and apply optimizing methods to acquire and interpret data that assists in decision and policy making. They gather and analyze data, establish business methods, and develop decision support software.

Optometrists perform eye exams to check patients for vision and eye diseases. They diagnose problems or impairments, prescribe corrective lenses, and provide treatment. They also provide pre- or post-operative care to patients that may need to undergo eye surgeries.

Workers in this field assist lawyers; they investigate facts, prepare legal documents, or research legal precedent. They may conduct research to support a legal proceeding, organize exhibits before trials, and call upon witnesses at court hearings.

Pediatricians work primarily with children to diagnose, treat, medicate, and help prevent children's diseases and injuries. They generally work out of a physician's office to examine children regularly and assess their growth and development from infancy to adolescence.

Many people need help with their investment, taxes, and insurance decisions. A personal financial advisors gives financial advice using their knowledge of tax and investment strategies in order to help clients make the best financial decisions for their future.

Petroleum engineers design methods to improve oil and gas extraction and production and if new or modified designs are needed. They oversee drilling, offer technical advice, and coordinate the installation, maintenance, and operation of mining and oil field equipment.

OccupationTitle: Petroleum Pump Operators, Refinery Operators, and Gaugers
Description: Working in a refinery, operators are expected to monitor and operate petroleum refining or processing units to detect and report possible problems. They also extensively analyze data to make laboratory recommendations and set equipment controls.

Pharmacists dispense and distribute prescription medications to patients. They offer advice on the selection, dosage, interactions, side effects of medications, and the safe use of medication. They also assess the identity, strength, or purity of medications.

Teachers in this field educate students on philosophy, religion, and theology. Topics may include ethics, logic, or contemporary religious thought. They develop lesson plans, deliver lectures, evaluate methods of instruction, and maintain student records.
Occupations in this field include astronomers, physicists, atmospheric and space scientists, chemists and materials scientists, and environmental scientists and geoscientists.

Physical therapist assistants work under the direction of physical therapists. They assist, provide treatment, and help to develop programs that best help the patient gain back the physical abilities that may have been lost due to injury or illness.

Physical therapists help people recover from injuries or illnesses in order to improve their movement and manage their pain. They assess, plan, and participate in rehabilitative programs involving exercise routines to correct or improve disabling conditions.

Working in a healthcare facility, physician assistants perform many of the same tasks typically performed by a physician. They assist physicians and conduct complete physicals, provide treatment, console patients, and occasionally even prescribe medication.

Physicians and surgeons diagnose and treat injuries and illnesses of patients in a wide variety of ways. Whether by preventative measures or invasive operations, physicians and surgeons help prevent and cure diseases and injuries that occur in the general population.

Physicists analyze data from conducted research to identify and evaluate physical phenomena. They often write for scientific journals or speak at conferences to report experimental results, and are expected to develop theories and laws based on their findings.

Physics instructors teach classes related to the laws of matter and energy. Courses may include quantum mechanics, particle physics, and optics. They conduct research, prepare and deliver lectures, maintain student records, and evaluate class work and exams.

OccupationTitle: Plant and System Operators, All Other
Description: Occupations in this field include various "green" careers with a very bright career outlook, including biofuels processing technicians, methane/landfill gas generation system technicians, biomass plant technicians, and hydroelectric plant technicians.

Plumbers, pipefitters, and steamfitters assemble, install, and repair pipelines and pipe systems that carry a variety of liquids and gasses. Some travel to areas such as factories, homes, businesses, and just about anywhere else there are pipes or septic systems.

Supervisors in this field direct activities within a police force. They supervise the investigation of criminal cases, train officers, detectives, and other workers in police procedures, and ensure those procedures are conducted in accordance with laws and regulations.

Workers in this field work to protect and maintain safety in their respective communities by enforcing local, tribal, State, and Federal laws and ordinances. They also perform duties such as patrolling, direct traffic, investigate criminal actions, and arrest suspects.

Instructors in this field of study teach courses in political science, international affairs, and international relations. Teachers prepare lesson plans, evaluate student class work, facilitate educational discussions, and maintain student records.

Postal service clerks weigh mail, sell stamps and envelopes, process change of address forms, and sort mail by hand or electronically. They must be knowledgeable of Postal Service federal regulations and other federal agencies.

Mail carriers sort, deliver, and pick-up mail (either by vehicle or on-foot) on a specific route. They also obtain signatures on mail, record address changes to redirect mail, and leave notices to inform people where to collect undeliverable mail.

OccupationTitle: Postal Service Sorters, Processors, and  Machine Operators
Description: Working in a busy mailroom, workers sort, prepare, and route incoming and outgoing mail for delivery. They also maintain records of shipments, operate and occasionally repair various mailroom machinery, and check package condition and postage paid prior to processing.

Postmasters and mail superintendents hire and train new employees, supervise areas such as processing, and resolve customer complaints. They also write detailed reports of post office operations to supervisors within one or a number of postal facilities.

This field refers to the small percentage of postsecondary teachers who don't fit into one of the specialty teaching areas. These teachers prepare lesson plans, grade tests and assignments, and maintain student records.

Working in a power plant, workers must be able to respond to emergencies such as power outages or transformer line failures. They also operate equipment that distributes electricity or steam and monitor switchboards to ensure that the equipment is operating properly.

Operators in a power plant primarily work with equipment; they adjust controls, maintain generators, clean and oil machines to prevent failure, and work with systems operators to regulate line voltages and transmission loads and frequencies.

OccupationTitle: Precision Instrument and Equipment Repairers, All Other
Description: This field refers to the small percentage of precision instrument and equipment repairers whose job duties aren't listed separately.

Workers in this field obtain and analyze information on suspects, crimes, or disturbances to solve cases, identify criminal activity, or gather information for court cases. They also perform background investigations, pre-employment checks, or financial investigations.

Workers in this field provide social services to help rehabilitate law offenders in custody, or on probation or parole. They help develop a rehabilitation plan or treatment for an offender, which may include conditional release and education or employment stipulations.

Producers and directors work in stage, television, radio, motion pictures, and video. They lead in the creation of script, development of characters and actors, collaborate with set designers, work with sound engineers, and discuss their vision with cinematographers.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: Workers in this field establish production schedules to coordinate and expedite work and materials for departments. They also distribute and review production and shipment schedules, work progress, and determine costs or production problems.

OccupationTitle: Property, Real Estate, and Community  Managers
Description: Workers in real estate coordinate and direct buying, leasing, and selling of commercial, industrial, and residential properties. They meet with prospective tenants to provide information on properties, inspect grounds, and prepare and maintain records of sale.

Psychiatrists diagnose, treat, and help prevent disorders that affect a person's thinking. They also prescribe, direct, and administer psychotherapeutic treatments or medications to treat mental, emotional, or behavioral disorders.

Psychologists in this field may do work related to cognitive psychology and psycholinguistics, community psychology, comparative psychology, developmental and child psychology, educational psychology, or environmental psychology.

Psychology instructors educate students in topics relating to psychology, such as psychological counseling or child, clinical, and developmental psychology. They select course materials, prepare lessons, and evaluate student class work.

Workers in this field coordinate activities aimed at creating or maintaining a favorable public image or raising issue awareness for their client or organization. They may also plan events to solicit funds for special projects or nonprofit organizations.

Public relations specialists work on maintaining a favorable public image for their employer or client. They write, plan, select, and direct public relations material for release to various media outlets. They also help to raise funds for their organization.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: Pump operators monitor gauges for temperatures, chemical amounts, the transfer of gases or oils, and pressure--and fix or report any errors. They control valves to regulate flow of materials and tend vessels that store substances or materials.

OccupationTitle: Purchasing Agents, Except Wholesale/Retail & Farm Products
Description: Workers in this field research and evaluate suppliers, prepare purchase orders and bid proposals, and review orders. In addition, they manage inventory, discuss defective or unacceptable goods with staff, users, and vendors, and determine future appropriate action.

Purchasing managers coordinate and plan for buyers, purchasing officers, and all other workers in the field of purchasing materials, products, and services for wholesale or retail markets. They also lead in the interviewing and hiring of new staff, and oversee training.

Radiation therapists provide radiation therapy to patients as prescribed by a radiologist, according to established standards. They may review prescription and diagnosis, prepare equipment, assist in dosimetry procedures, or maintain records and files.

OccupationTitle: Radio, Cellular, and Tower Equipment Installers
Description: Workers in this industry repair, install, and maintain a variety of transmitting, broadcasting, and receiving equipment. Workers visit many different sites and may even climb tall towers in order to access the different equipment that needs to be maintained.

Radiologic technologists and technicians perform diagnostic imaging examinations such as x-rays, CT scans, and MRIs on patients. The use radiation safety measures and protection devices to comply with government regulations and to ensure safety of patients and staff.

Rail car repairers diagnose and repair railroad rolling stock, mine cars, or mass transit rail cars. They test units for proper execution, perform scheduled maintenance on units, and inspect components to determine if repairs are needed.

OccupationTitle: Railroad Brake, Signal, and Switch Operators
Description: An integral role in keeping trains working properly and on the right track, railroad operators operate switches to move trains successfully, signal engineers to start or stop trains, inspect tracks, cars, and engines, and assemble and break up cars on the train.

Railroad conductors signal engineers to start and stop trains, direct yard activities of switch-engine crew, and the moving and coupling of cars. Similarly, yardmasters review train schedules and direct yard switching and the coupling/uncoupling of cars.

OccupationTitle: Rail-Track Laying and Maintenance Equipment Operators
Description: These operators lay, repair, and maintain track for transportation locomotive services as well as plant yards, quarries, sand and gravel pits, and mines. They supervise certain sections at a time, repair and maintain tracks (clean and lubricate) and adjust controls.

Real estate brokers typically sell or rent properties and arrange loans for prospective buyers. They also operate real estate offices, oversee real estate transactions, and maintain knowledge of fair housing laws and finance options.

OccupationTitle: Recreation and Fitness Studies Teachers, Postsecondary
Description: Instructors in this field teach classes in recreation, leisure, and fitness studies. Specific topics may include anatomy, therapeutic recreation, or conditioning theory. They develop curriculum, facilitate discussions, and evaluate student assignments and fieldwork.

Recreational therapists coordinate medically-approved recreation programs for patients in hospitals, nursing homes, or other institutions. They evaluate patients and advise appropriate activities, such as sports, arts and crafts, games, and other social activities.

Registered nurses (RNs) provide and coordinate basic patient medical care, educate public about various health conditions, advise about disease prevention, provide case management, advice, and emotional support for patients. Licensing and registration are required.

Respiratory therapists work with patients who have trouble breathing, have chronic respiratory diseases, or have problems such as asthma or emphysema. They sometimes also provide emergency care such as artificial respiration, or external cardiac massage.

Under the direction of therapists and physicians, the technician monitors patients during treatment. They collect and analyze blood samples, assess patients' response to treatments, keep  records of treatment, and set controls for various oxygen equipment.

Riggers set up and repair equipment for construction, manufacturing, ships, logging yards and even the entertainment industry. Riggers also direct workers for moving loads, ensure the safety of workers and materials, and control movement of heavy equipment.

OccupationTitle: Rotary Drill Operators for Oil and Gas
Description: Workers in this field operate and set up different types of drills to remove gas and oil from the ground. They also remove samples of gas and oil for tests and exploration, while maintaining records of location and footage drilled.

Sales engineers sell products requiring extensive technical knowledge and support for installation and use. They provide technical and non-technical support to clients and diagnose equipment problems, while planning and modifying product configurations to meet needs.

Sales managers help coordinate sales distribution for territories, quotas, and goals to establish training programs for employees. They are also expected to determine price schedules and discounts, approve and prepare budgets, and oversee staffing and training.

OccupationTitle: Sales Rep., Wholesale Manufacturing, Except Technical Product
Description: Workers in this field sell goods for manufacturers or wholesalers to businesses or individuals. They recommend products to customers, provide catalogs or product samples, estimate or quote prices and delivery dates, and follow up with them to provide continued support.

OccupationTitle: Sales Rep., Wholesale/ Manufacturing, Technical Products
Description: Sales representatives in this field sell goods for wholesalers or manufacturers of products that require technical or scientific knowledge. These areas include biology, engineering, chemistry, and electronics.
This field refers to the small percentage of occupations that do not fall into the other sales representative and service categories.

OccupationTitle: Secondary School Teachers, Except Special & Technical Ed.
Description: Teachers in this field typically teach students one or more subjects; English, math, or social studies at a secondary level in the private or public schools. They prepare and grade classwork and homework, enforce policies and rules, and maintain student records.

OccupationTitle: Securities, Commodities, and Financial Services Sales Agents
Description: Workers in this field provide financial services to businesses and individuals. They also advise customers about stocks, bonds, mutual funds, and market conditions or buying and selling securities or commodities in investment and trading firms.

OccupationTitle: Service Unit Operators, Oil, Gas, and Mining
