Description: Workers in this field typically work and operate machinery and equipment to increase oil flow from producing wells that have stuck pipes, casings, or other obstructions. They operate pumps that circulate fluids, close and seal wells, and direct drilling crews.

Sheet metal workers assemble, install, and repair sheet metal products and equipment. They may operate welding equipment, shape metal using a hammer, transport parts to construction sites, or prepare completed units for installation.

Ship engineers manage activities of crew who operate and maintain engines, boilers, deck machinery, and electrical equipment aboard the ship. They maintain safety equipment, evaluate and repair equipment as needed, and follow other direction from the captain.

Social and community service managers direct and lead staff for social services programs and community organizations. They evaluate the work of staff and volunteers to ensure that programs are of appropriate quality and that resources are used efficiently

OccupationTitle: Social Scientists and Related Workers, All Other
Description: Occupations in this field include anthropologists, archaeologists, geographers, historians, political scientists, economists, sociologists, and urban and regional planners.

Social workers identify those who need help and assist them in developing plans to improve their well-being. They help clients adjust to challenges such as illness, divorce, or unemployment. They also help clients obtain resources such as food stamps or Medicare.

Instructors in this field educate students about sociology. Topics may include race and ethnic relations, measurement and data collection, and workplace social relations. Teachers develop lesson plans, moderate classroom discussions, and evaluate student course work.

Working with the latest technology software, developers develop, create, and modify general computer applications, software, or specialized utility programs. They design or customize software for client use with the aim of optimizing operational efficiency.

Software developers are the creative minds behind computer programs. They develop many different applications and underlying systems control networks. They also modify existing software to correct errors and adapt new hardware to improve performance.

Soil and plant scientists research crops and agricultural plantssuch as trees and shrubsalong with how to control pests. They also study chemicals regarding physical, biological, and mineralogical compositions of soils for healthy plant and crop growth.

Sound technicians use equipment to record, mix, or produce music, voices, or sound effects in various venues including sporting arenas, theater products, recording studios, movie and sound productions, and any other venue where media might be recorded.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: Teachers in this field instruct middle school subjects to educationally and physically handicapped students;  including those who teach basic academic and life skills to the mentally impaired and those who work with audibly and visually impaired students.

OccupationTitle: Special Education Teachers, Preschool & Elementary School*
Description: In a classroom setting, special education teachers teach elementary and preschool subjects to students who have a wide range of learning, mental, emotional and physical disabilities. They develop and modify strategies and lessons to best fit each students needs.

Special education teachers teach secondary school subjects to mentally and physically handicapped students. They also work with students who are impaired audibly and visually. They may teach traditional courses, but also various personal developmental skills.

Speech-language pathologists work with people that have speech, language, voice, communication, fluency, and swallowing disorders in order to diagnose and treat them. They work in schools and healthcare facilities and monitor patients' progress during treatment.

Stationary engineers and boiler operators typically maintain and operate boilers, generators, motors, stationary engines, turbines, or other mechanical equipment to provide energy for industrial buildings.

Statisticians adapt analytical methods to solve problems in many different fields. They analyze and evaluate procedures to acquire valid, applicable, and accurate data. They must then report results, often in the form of graphs, charts, or tables.

Structural iron and steel workers install, raise, place, and unite iron and steel girders, beams and columns. They work to form completed structures, bridges, buildings, or structural frameworks by following blueprints and instructions from supervisors.

OccupationTitle: Supervisors of Farming, Fishing, and Forestry Workers
Description: Occupations in this field include first-line supervisors of logging workers, aquacultural workers, agricultural crop and horticultural workers, and animal husbandry and animal care workers.

OccupationTitle: Supervisors of Fire Fighting and Prevention Workers
Description: First-line supervisors of fire fighting and prevention workers supervise workers in the fire fighting and prevention fields as well as coordinate activities. Occupations also include municipal and forest fire fighting and prevention supervisors.

OccupationTitle: Supervisors of Helpers, Laborers, and Material Movers
Description: First-line supervisors directly supervise and coordinate the efforts and activities of helpers, laborers, and material movers. They manage operational day-to-day activities, plan work schedules, and assign duties to maintain adequate staff for effective performance.

OccupationTitle: Supervisors of Mechanics, Installers, and Repairers
Description: First-line supervisors of mechanics, installers, and repairers supervise and monitor employees work and review work performance. They compile operational or personnel records or test results, and monitor inventory for tools and parts for adequate work conditions.

OccupationTitle: Supervisors of Office and Administrative Support Workers
Description: Supervisors in this field oversee the work of administrative or customer service employees to ensure they are abiding by company policies. They train employees in job duties and provide instruction when needed. They also recruit, interview, and select new employees.

OccupationTitle: Supervisors of Protective Service Workers, All Other
Description: This field refers to the small percentage of first line supervisors of protective service workers whose job duties aren't listed separately. This may include supervisors in law enforcement and fire fighting and prevention.

OccupationTitle: Supervisors of Transportation/ Machine & Vehicle Operators
Description: Supervisors in this field plan assignments and allocate equipment to vehicle operators to meet production goals. They review orders, schedules, and shipping notices to determine work sequences while maintaining records of time, materials, and crew activities.

Surgeons use a variety of different surgical methods to operate on patients in order to treat disease, injuries and deformities. They usually work in sterile environments while performing surgery and may stand for long periods of time.

Surgical technicians assist in operations under the supervision of surgeons, registered nurses, or other surgical staff. They help prepare the operating room, transport patients to surgery, adjust lights or equipment, and hand tools or other supplies to the surgeons.

Survey researchers plan, support, develop, coordinate, and conduct operations for surveys. They also analyze and interpret the meaning of survey data, determine survey objectives, suggest or test question wording, review, classify, and record survey data.

Surveyors establish official boundaries for land, airspace, and water. They make exact measurements, calculations, and verify accuracy of survey data at survey sites. They examine shape, contour, gravitation, location, elevation, and dimension of land or land features.

Tapers seal joints between plasterboard or other wallboard to prepare the wall's surface for painting or papering. They remove the extra compound after surfaces have been covered sufficiently and spread sealing compound between boards or panels and cracks.

OccupationTitle: Tax Examiners and Collectors, and Revenue Agents
Description: Tax examiners, collectors, and revenue agents determine tax liability and collect taxes from businesses, companies, or individuals per laws and regulations. They maintain records of each case, assist and answer taxpayer questions, and discuss problems with returns.

Writers in this field compose technical materials such as equipment manuals, appendices, or operating and maintenance instructions. They make edits, select photos, diagrams, or charts to illustrate material, and  assist in laying out elements for publication.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

OccupationTitle: Telecommunications Equipment Repairers, Except Line Installers
Description: Workers in this field service or repair communications equipment for customers, such as cable television, telephone and Internet. They also install or remove switching, distribution, routing, and dialing equipment used in central offices or master facilities.

Workers in this field install, maintain, and repair lines or cables for customers. They set up services and inspect or analyze lines and cables to locate faults. They also install equipment to uphold the strength of communications transmissions.

Therapists counsel individuals or groups regarding psychological or emotional problems such as stress, substance abuse, or family situations. They develop and implement therapeutic treatment plans. They can work in a residential or business setting.

Tire builders possess the trade knowledge and skills necessary to operate machinery that forms automotive tires out of rubber. They work with equipment such as molds and rollers and create tires based on blueprint specifications.

Workers in this field require an organized and analytical mindset to examine documents in a variety of environments. They may summarize legal data at law firms, examine mortgages at real estate agencies, or prepare property title reports at insurance companies.

Tool and die makers operate machines to make tools based on blueprints and specification plans. They verify dimensions, conduct test runs, assemble and repair tools and parts, and select metalsall in accordance to quality standards.

Managers in this field plan, direct, and coordinate all training and developmental exercises for an organization. Managers may conduct orientation sessions for new staff, develop and analyze employee surveys, or evaluate and improve existing training programs.

Training and development specialists create programs to improve an organization and work with staff to improve their job skills. They analyze work procedures to come up with alternative methods of training if the expected improvements are not seen.
Transportation inspectors examine equipment and goods to ensure the safe transport of people or cargo. This includes inspectors of all transportation vehicles, such as freight and rail inspectors.

Workers in this field work with logistics managers to coordinate transportation, storage and distribution with organizational policies and applicable government laws and regulations. They hire, train, and supervise warehouse personnel.

Planners in this field develop comprehensive plans for use of land and physical facilities of cities, counties, and metropolitan areas. They hold public meetings to formulate community plans and conduct research to gather data to support proposals.

Veterinarians care for animals in a variety of ways; they diagnose, treat, and research medical conditions and diseases for pets, livestock, and animals in zoos, racetracks, and laboratories. They prescribe medications, set bones, dress wounds, and perform surgery.

Teachers in this field instruct vocational or occupational subjects. This includes industrial and commercial instructors, adult education teachers, or instructors who prepare others to operate industrial, transportation, or communication equipment.

OccupationTitle: Water and Waste Treatment Plant/ System Operators
Description: Operators in this field work to control, inspect, and operate water treatment facilities and machines. They maintain and repair equipment, record data, add chemicals to water and other liquids, and direct plant workers in routine operations and maintenance activities.

Wellhead pumpers operate control panels and power pumps to ensure that materials are being pumped correctly. They repair equipment such as pumps, hoses, gas and oil meters, and gauges. They check the pressure of various valves to determine correct oil flow.

OccupationTitle: Wholesale and Retail Buyers, Except Farm Products
Description: Workers in this field purchase both durable and non-durable goods for resale to consumers at the wholesale and retail level. They also analyze buying and sales trends to determine product price, quality of merchandise, and current value of goods.
Writers and authors concept and create written content such as advertisements, scripts, and stories. This may also include copywriters, poets, lyricists, and other creative writers.
Category: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media

Description: Zoologists and wildlife biologists study the behavior, lifestyle, genetics, origin and life-cycle of wildlife and animals in their natural habitat. Some specialize in areas such as wildlife, conservation management, or aquatic biology.
